title: Kalista should have the lowest attack range of any adc to make up for her passive.
body: She has more range than lucian and others... She needs to be punished for her massively annoying passive and I think it's a good way to make her not so annoyingly strong right now

replies.body:
Kalista needs two changes.

1) Make slows reduce the distance of her jumps.

2) Make her spears change color when there are enough stacked in someone to execute them.

It would make playing as and against her far less aggravating.

I more prefer that slows don't reduce the distance, more that they increase the time it takes to get from start of dash to end of dash. For instance, say Kalista takes half a second to complete the dash, gets a 50% slow, now takes 3/4 a second to complete the dash.

this will hurt her at high attack speeds. Kalista has already had problems with her passive not being able to keep up with attack speed.

and by hurt her at high attack speeds, i mean bugs/glitches.

Must say I'm more than for this. 

Slows reducing jump distance should just be obvious, CC counters mobility and all right? 

As for the second change, I would take that prior nerf AND the AA range nerf OP suggested just for that QOL change (though I'd rather not of course... her AA range is fine) . My biggest issue with playing as Kalista, even moreso then knowing when to ult or properly hopping mid teamfight, is seeing 600 spears on the enemy Thresh and thinking "Yeah that should be enough" only for it to take him to 200 hp.

The AA nerf would be incredibly stupid. Why give a champ a unique strength just to make it, it's greatest weakness. Come on guys, Kalista is NOT  hard to shut down with the proper team comp. She gets countered hard by some and counters some hard. She's very binary by who she counters and doesn't. I'm getting tired of these threads.
A full ranged team comp.

how would she jump if she can't auto?
urgot's range is 425
Better than pre-6 Gnar
last time I checked urgot didn't have any gapclosers/escapes :/
Last I checked, Gnar didn't have a 1000-1200 range skillshot/targeted damage spell with a 2 second cooldown, but now we're just arguing diverse advantages.

Boomerang Throw	RANGE: 1100
hmmm...

Base Cooldown: 20/17.5/15/12.5/10, reduced by 45/50/55/60% if he catches it depending on ult rank.

**Compared to 2 seconds**

I don't even know why I'm being downvoted; the subject of the thread was attack range, and it's true that Urgot's range beats Gnar's until he's level 6.

Maybe because Urgot has to ht a 900 range spell first that is really slow and costs a ton of his mana early and has a long cooldown while Gnar can just spam his manaless long range spell as long as he catches it?

*This wasn't an argument about who was better*

Good. God. Gnar's basic attack range before level 6 is less than 425. That was the only thing I was saying, and then he brings up Gnar's Q. I figured I'd just point out that Urgot's Q has approximately the same range, a much lower cooldown, and can be turned into a guaranteed targeted spell, *but the semantics of their skill difference were not important.*

I'm not trying to say Urgot > Gnar. I never *would* try to convince *anyone* of that. Urgot's attack range is *slightly* longer than Gnar's, until after Gnar is level 6. That was it. Nothing else.

Look, just don't compare poor Urgot to one of the most op champs in League right now, it just hurts man.

We feel his tears (he has to stack it) and we downvote to make him feel happier.

> [{quoted}](name=Hard Penetrator,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=OOu9EKk7,comment-id=00010000000000000000000000000000000100000000,timestamp=2015-02-08T20:55:30.171+0000)

> First of all "OP" means OP against other similar picks and right now Gnar is absolute TOP tier, if you can tell me what melee champs can go even or win against a really good Gnar I will admit he isn't "OP". 

OP is the shorthand of Overpowered, which is a term used to describe a champion who is too strong. It either refers to their stats being too high, their spells/abilities having numbers that are too high, or having a particular mechanic that gives them too much strength.

If you want a similar pick comparison, why don't you compare Gnar to Jayce? They're both champions with melee/ranged kits, they're both Fighter/Marksmen, they both have a solid amount of AoE, CC, burst and DPS in their kits, and they've both been the target of rampant butthurt from players losing to them.
> Second. You started a discussion over observation. If you would just left it right there no one would say anything. Calling out Urgot Acid Hunter while Urgot is arguably weakest champ in LoL was unnecessary.  Its like saying that Olaf bonus ad at lvl 6 is higher than Zeds. It is true but it feels like rubbing chili pepper into open wound.

If your ass is so raw over the fact that I had the audacity to bring up a stupid comparison for no reason, then please feel free to continue shitstorming over it. You misunderstood the implications of what I said, and you can continue to PMS over it.
You have permission to compare the two when Gnar requires a Manamune to do ANYTHING

I was comparing *one* aspect of them. Their basic attack ranges.

The OP was saying Kalista should have a short attack range. King Dodo named Urgot's 425 range. I named Gnar's level 1 range of 400. Insert shitstorm because people think I'm comparing Urgot as a whole to Gnar as a whole.
I dont consider Urgot an adc lmao... Maye 500 with lucian and the rest of the low auto range champs... 500 is pretty brutal but she has the ability to get in and out

Thing is, Lucian was reduced to 500 for how much mobility he has. But then you look at Kalista, who has way more mobility than Lucian, and 500 still looks generous. Then you look at Kalista's utility, which is one thing most immobile ADC's have had going for them, and Kalista's range at 500 looks like it's still ridiculous.

Kalista could probably go down to 450 auto attack range and still be really strong, even as an ADC.
Only once she got past what would be a brutal early game filled with poking.

What's wrong with having a bad early game?

Not to mention not having a good early game isn't that big of a problem on a utility ADC like Kalista because you are always more useful when behind than an ADC with no utility.

Nothing wrong with a bad early game if base stats are enough to help you scale into late. Kalista could certainly use some sort of nerf to help tone down her insane mobility mid-late game. However, I believe that there are better levers than simply reducing her attack range. I'm not experienced enough to pick which ones to pull, though.

There are certainly other levers, but when you consider Kalista's identity of a super mobile ADC with utility, and there aren't a whole lot of other levers to pull.

Reducing her range is probably the best way to do this, although reducing her damage would also be a good lever to tune. Keep in mind that reducing Kalista's damage would probably leave her with damage even lower than Ashe, unless both her range and her damage both get hits.

Lucian was reduced to 500 because of his incredible mobility, AND BURST, not to mention generally stronger laning presence than Kalista due to said burst.  He was also compensated heavily for the above nerf if you remember correctly and is rarely played now due to a large part of that compensation being removed.

If you gave Kalista a bigger nerf than Lucian took, that would completely kill her.  She would be forced out in the early game by the enormous range advantage literally every ADC had on her and never manage to make use of her mobility because she's just too far away to attack anything or build up the AS required for her mobility.  Remember that Lucian's mobility isn't reliant on having a target in auto range.

She's already at a comparable level to other currently strong ADCs, from Jinx to Sivir to Caitlyn.  Don't single out Kalista for gutting.

Edit: Again with the downvotes and no replies.  Guess I shouldn't post a contrary opinion to a "Let's nerf Kalista" thread...

Lucian has a lot of mobility and burst. Kalista has less burst, but has more mobility and has utility that is only rivaled by League's immobile utility carries in Ashe and Varus. Lucian has no utility to speak of.

The changes I recommended are hardly a "gutting". This still keeps Kalista's insane amount of mobility and utility with a real weakness in a lack of range.

Also, keep in mind that Kalista doesn't need a target to use her mobility in some degree because she can dash after using her Q.

In regard to the current strong ADC's keep in mind that this a Kalista thread. I said nothing about singling out Kalista over Jinx/Sivir/Caitlyn/whateverADCisstrongrightnow. I just mentioned Kalista over those other ADCs because Kalista was the champion-of-interest in this thread.

First, thanks for replying.  Now we can actually talk like human beings.

Kalista has a LOT less burst than Lucian.  Lucian's passive and Q result in much higher damage output when compared to Kalista's Rend, which will tend to stack up enough to equal a single Luc Q.  Luc can then keep using his passive and easily surpass Kalista in damage.  As for the utility argument, Utility and mobility mean nothing when you struggle to deliver damage.  You'll notice how often you're comparing Kalista to champions who are traditionally thought of as the weaker part of the ADC crowd.  I'm not averse to seeing any of those champs buffed (especially Ashe), but I don't think they should be the bar set on strength.

And if you don't thing these changes are a gutting, look at what losing 50 range did to Lucian.  Much of his kit is quite similar to how he was on release due to Riot removing many of the buffs he got.  When was the last time you saw a really powerful Lucian?  When (outside of his free week) was the last time you saw a Lucian at all?  That change was HALF of what you're proposing for Kalista.  You should be able to reason it out from there why I referred to it as gutting her.  Range nerfs, especially on ADCs tend to have enormous consequences, which is why Riot figured the only way to reduce Lucian's then HUGELY dominant power was to nerf his range.  Kalista shows none of that overbearing strength, so why hit her harder than Lucian?

Her Q dash is, like the rest of her dashes, very short ranged.  It's a short enough dash that it's actually pretty difficult to get over any walls with it (short of J4's Cataclysm), which is something most other mobile ADCs do with ease.

And finally, why I brought up the comparison argument.  The reason I mentioned the other ADCs wasn't to change the thread topic, but to show that Kalista's not alone on her level.  Traditionally, the forums call anything they don't like "OP", but in this case it seems to be just an argument of "I don't like this, remove it."  She's mobile, sure.  But she sacrifices natural steroids for her mobility and has a good portion of her power gated by cooperation with her support.  She's one among equals and I don't think she needs to be nerfed just because she's unique among her peers.

Utility means that you don't need to deal damage to be useful. Kalista may get stomped by a Lucian in lane, but she's still just as useful as him when she's down two items because of the power she has in the utility she has. Also, keep in mind that Lucian was the best ADC in the game when he lost his 50 range, and needed several patches of nerfs to balance him out.

Likewise, her dashes are spammable. It doesn't matter that they are short in that sense, because Kaista can use them for an indefinite amount of time. At 500-550 range, you cannot deal with her with a large majority of champs due to both range and mobility discrepancies, while closer to 400-475 range, you can fight her with a larger majority of champs without Kalista feeling useless.

Utility means you have use outside damage.  Doesn't mean that you're going to be able to make up a two item lead with you ghosts and your ult.  She's not Ashe.  She doesn't have a permaslow.  She doesn't have a long range stun.  Her usefulness is still dependent on her damage and her ability to get that damage down.  You don't see Ashe's laning phase being destroyed purely based on the fact that she has utility, do you?  Then why do it to Kalista?

As far as Lucian, you noticed they gave him a bunch of compensation buffs when he lost the 50 range, didn't you?  Most of which were taken away which led to his current state?  If you're wondering, I can link you to a page with the exact changes made during that era.  Most of them were buffs to make up for the range nerf.

And yes, her dashes are spammable.  Dependent on her attack speed.  Before she grabs a Hurricane or BotRK, she's probably on par with the likes of Lucian, Graves, and Ezrael without the ability damage to make up for it.  Unlike most of the League, her mobility is dependent on her itemization and thus she suffers as is in lane because of it.  If Udyr ganks her in that time, he'll catch her.  If Lee ganks her in that time, he'll catch her.  If J4 ganks in that time, he'll catch her.  It's a point of weakness that most of the forum seems to be forgetting about.

And for not being able to fight her at that range, what makes you think that she'll be more managable at 400-475 range than 500-550?  550 is already within most point-and-click spell ranges and she'll be just as mobile and able to dodge skillshots at 400.  All you'll do is make her laning phase hell as she's unable to catch the opposing Caitlyn, Jinx, or Corki and unable to deal meaningful damage when she does, meaning she'll fall behind and be unable to do anything.

In fact, compare Kalista to Caitlyn for a second, think of the number of champs who can catch Caitlyn, and compare your list there to that of Kalista.  Which champs can Kalista kite that Cait can't?

For that matter, why is Kalista in particular so OP?  All I'm hearing is her advertised strengths, with her weaknesses conveniently left out and comparisons to champions considered weak.  Should Twitch's or Ashe's current strength be the bar all ADCs should be compared to?

Who can can catch Kalista that can't catch Caitlyn? Over half the number of champions in the game. Lower Kalista's auto attack range below 500, and then those numbers start to get around the same. It's no question that the mobility and CC that Kalista has if far beyond that of Caitlyn.

You don't see talk about Kalista's weaknesses is because she really doesn't have any weaknesses, and her oppressive strengths crowd out every single weakness she may have. Not to mention all the comparisons people are making are to weaker champs that Kalista crowds out because they fill similar roles that Kalista does better, not because we want Kalista to be nerfed to the bottom of all the ADC's in the game. Its not a matter of balance, it's a matter of the role they fill compared to other ADC's.

Or maybe do it in pieces? Kalista's current range is 550, so how about first nerfing it to 525 (Graves, Jinx minigun) and only then to 500 (Sivir, Lucian) if she's still a problem?
Or just nerf her passive so it's a constant range always instead of longer when she's kiting away.
It makes you feel better if you think of it as shorter if you jump forwards. The forwards jump has always felt wrong to me. I think Riot just said longer backwards so she sounds stronger.
